definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: I will join a circus and fly away on a flying trapeze.
sentences.chinese: 我就要變成馬戲團裏的空中飛人，飛得高高的。

sentences.english: Michael Jorden surnamed “Flying Trapezist” has stepped out of the NBA.
sentences.chinese: “空中飛人”邁克爾喬丹已從NBA中退役了。

sentences.english: Too many jordan shoes online shops to make the correct decision for the air jordans.
sentences.chinese: 太多約旦鞋網上商店作出正確決定的空中飛人。

sentences.english: This is a lot of trapeze is a big temptation.
sentences.chinese: 這一點對於很多空中飛人來說，是個很大的誘惑。

sentences.english: All acrobats wear safety belts when performing flying person.
sentences.chinese: 演空中飛人時都要系保險帶。

sentences.english: By the time he was nine years old, he was already performing as a trapeze artist.
sentences.chinese: 他年僅九歲時，便已經在表演空中飛人的特技。

definition: Hong Kong Wetland Park, in Yuen Long, New Territories
pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Shi1 di4 Gong1 yuan2

definition: body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
monkey (dialect)/little monkey (affectionate term for children, subordinates)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
